title: Setting x._backward_hooks to None doesn't error, doesn't clear hooks
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

import torch

y = torch.ones(5, 5, requires_grad=True)

counter = [0]
def bw_hook(grad):
    counter[0] += 1

z = y + y
test = z.register_hook(bw_hook)
print(z._backward_hooks)
z._backward_hooks = None
print(z._backward_hooks)
z.backward(torch.ones(5, 5), retain_graph=True)
print(counter)

this prints:

$ python hooky.py               
OrderedDict([(0, <function bw_hook at 0x7f2c9ab69e18>)])
None
[1]

Expected behavior

I expect to either get an error, saying you can't set _backward_hooks to None, or for hooks to be cleared if I do this.

## 🐛 Bug

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```
import torch

y = torch.ones(5, 5, requires_grad=True)

counter = [0]
def bw_hook(grad):
    counter[0] += 1

z = y + y
test = z.register_hook(bw_hook)
print(z._backward_hooks)
z._backward_hooks = None
print(z._backward_hooks)
z.backward(torch.ones(5, 5), retain_graph=True)
print(counter)
```

this prints:

```
$ python hooky.py               
OrderedDict([(0, <function bw_hook at 0x7f2c9ab69e18>)])
None
[1]
```

## Expected behavior

I expect to either get an error, saying you can't set `_backward_hooks` to None, or for hooks to be cleared if I do this.
